intro: Guapurium herbaceum, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or Brazilian cherry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Guapurium herbaceum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
